intro: Hypenia, commonly known as the false mallow, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are shrubs or small trees native to tropical and subtropical regions. The plants typically have simple, alternate leaves and produce showy, five-petaled flowers in shades of pink, red, or purple. Hypenia species are often cultivated for their ornamental value due to their attractive foliage and blooms. They prefer well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade for optimal growth.
